activities: Tiffany obtains and processes personal data when carrying out and supporting human resources functions and activities, including: (1) recruiting and hiring job applicants; (2) monitoring, evaluating and managing employee performance; (3) administering employee compensation and benefits; (4) conducting ethics and disciplinary investigations and managing claims; (5) administering code of conduct and privacy and security training programs; (6) managing employee attendance; (7) managing the company directory; (8) managing information technology and communications systems, such as the corporate email system; (9) accounting for purchases by employees; (10) managing talent development; (11) facilitating employee mobility and managing international assignments; (12) facilitating incident reporting and security management; (13) administering the employee whistleblower hotline; (14) verifying employee identification; (15) managing audit and compliance matters; (16) performing workforce analytics and reporting; (17) integration planning, including business continuity and disaster recovery; (18) managing the employee termination process; (19) complying with applicable legal obligations; and (20) handling other human resources issues.
contacttitle1: Associate General Counsel & Chief Privacy Officer
corpofftitle1: Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human resources data, including manually processed data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner
